t: Isaiah 19
A Prophecy Against Egypt
A*p prophecy against Egypt: See,*pn the Lord*s rides on a swift cloud and*ld is coming to Egypt. The*ln idols of Egypt tremble before him, and*ld the hearts of the Egyptians melt with fear.
“I*pn will stir up Egyptian against Egyptian— brother*ld will fight against brother, neighbor*ld against neighbor, city*ld against city, kingdom*ld against kingdom.
The*ln Egyptians will lose heart, and*ld I will bring their plans to nothing; they*ln will consult the idols and the spirits of the dead, the*ld mediums and the spiritists.
I*ln will hand the Egyptians over to*ld the power of a cruel master, and*ln a fierce king will rule over them,” declares*ld the Lord, the Lord*s Almighty.
The*pn waters of the river will dry up, and*ld the riverbed will be parched and dry.
The*ln canals will stink; the*ld streams of Egypt will dwindle and dry up. The*ln reeds and rushes will wither,
also*ld the plants along the Nile, at*ld the mouth of the river. Every*ln sown field along the Nile will*ld become parched, will blow away and be no more.
The*ln fishermen will groan and lament, all*ld who cast hooks into the Nile; those*ln who throw nets on the water will*ld pine away.
Those*ln who work with combed flax will despair, the*ld weavers of fine linen will lose hope.
The*ln workers in cloth will be dejected, and*ld all the wage earners will be sick at heart.

The*pn officials of Zoan are nothing but fools; the*ld wise counselors of Pharaoh give senseless advice. How*ln can you say to Pharaoh, “I*ld am one of the wise men, a*ld disciple of the ancient kings”?
Where*pn are your wise men now? Let*ld them show you and make known what*ln the Lord*s Almighty has*ld planned against Egypt.
The*ln officials of Zoan have become fools, the*ld leaders of Memphis are deceived; the*ln cornerstones of her peoples have*ld led Egypt astray.
The*ln Lord*s has poured into them a*ld spirit of dizziness; they*ln make Egypt stagger in all that she does, as*ld a drunkard staggers around in his vomit.
There*ln is nothing Egypt can do— head*ld or tail, palm branch or reed.
In*p that day the Egyptians will become weaklings. They will shudder with fear at the uplifted hand that the Lord*s Almighty raises against them.
And the land of Judah will bring terror to the Egyptians; everyone to whom Judah is mentioned will be terrified, because of what the Lord*s Almighty is planning against them.
In*p that day five cities in Egypt will speak the language of Canaan and swear allegiance to the Lord*s Almighty. One of them will be called the City of the Sun.
In*p that day there will be an altar to the Lord*s in the heart of Egypt, and a monument to the Lord*s at its border.

It will be a sign and witness to the Lord*s Almighty in the land of Egypt. When they cry out to the Lord*s because of their oppressors, he will send them a savior and defender, and he will rescue them.

So the Lord*s will make himself known to the Egyptians, and in that day they will acknowledge the Lord.*s They will worship with sacrifices and grain offerings; they will make vows to the Lord*s and keep them.
The Lord*s will strike Egypt with a plague; he will strike them and heal them. They will turn to the Lord,*s and he will respond to their pleas and heal them.
In*p that day there will be a highway from Egypt to Assyria. The Assyrians will go to Egypt and the Egyptians to Assyria. The Egyptians and Assyrians will worship together.
In that day Israel will be the third, along with Egypt and Assyria, a blessing on the earth.
The Lord*s Almighty will bless them, saying, “Blessed be Egypt my people, Assyria my handiwork, and Israel my inheritance.”
